intro: Stachytarpheta puberula, commonly known as the velvetleaf or purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Stachytarpheta puberula is also sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
